result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan P Conner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.
Must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations, including any outstanding ZCI (Zimmerman Consulting Inc) testing and monitoring fees.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate. Follow through with recommendations.  Comply with any Family Court and child support orders.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations, including aftercare programming.  No association with any known users of controlled substances.

timeConds.notes: AMENDED 10-13-2017:  Sentence modified to include conditional jail time.   **AMENDED 12-11-2017:  Defendant to be released to custody of DOC on December 14, 2017 so he can be transported to MSDF for AODA Program; balance of conditional time is stayed.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    No contact with the co-defendant. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
